org.name: Marrow's Edge
org.tagline: Marrow’s Edge. Of the core and at the precipice.
org.description: We are a performance company dedicated to creating work that simultaneously draws from "the canon" and defies the expectations and conventions of the theatrical experience.  Founded by **Ria T. DiLullo** (director) and **Daria Miyeko Marinelli** (playwright), Marrowʼs Edge strives to create theatrical work that is supported by a strong and open process from page to stage and that lives both of the core and at the precipice.

work.title: Beatrice
work.description: Beatrice Portinari is just another badass girl who plays the flute. Except for the fact that she lives in Medieval 13th Century Italy. And music really sucks because there's no polyphony. And society has forced her to marry. And she's being followed by this really annoying guy who keeps writing poems about her. Loosely based on the figure at the center of Dante's Vita Nuova and Divine Comedy, BEATRICE is a story of Heaven and Hell, life and death, love and loss, a woman ahead of her time, and the number three.
